title: Test STR - MODFLOW Stream Routing Demonstration
description: Demonstrates the STR (Stream Routing) package in MODFLOW-2005 for modeling stream networks, surface water-groundwater interactions, and flow routing calculations

packages.purpose: Stream routing and surface water-groundwater interaction
Grid discretization for stream network framework
Basic package with stream corridor boundary conditions
Enhanced hydraulic conductivity in stream alluvium
Output control for heads and stream flows

package_details.STR: Stream routing package for surface water flow networks
package_details.DIS: Structured discretization supporting stream cell definition
package_details.BAS: Basic package with stream corridor active/inactive cells
package_details.LPF: Layer property flow with enhanced alluvial conductivity
package_details.OC: Output control for stream-aquifer interaction results
package_details.PCG: Iterative solver for coupled stream-groundwater system

key_features: STR package for stream routing and flow calculations
Stream network topology with segment-reach structure
Seasonal flow variations and boundary condition management
Stream channel geometry and hydraulic parameter specification
learning_objectives: Understanding STR package capabilities and stream routing concepts
Implementing stream network topology and connectivity
Applying Manning's equation for channel flow calculations
Managing seasonal flow variations and temporal boundary conditions
Integrating stream systems with groundwater flow models
Understanding professional applications of stream routing modeling
